case_vignette: A 27-year-old man presents to the emergency department after an episode of palpitations followed by syncope. He awoke after being unconscious for several seconds but still has a sensation of palpitations. The patient is not currently followed by a primary care doctor but states that he has never had any health problems. His temperature is 98.5°F (36.9°C), blood pressure is 133/91 mmHg, pulse is 95/min, respirations are 19/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. An electrocardiogram (ECG) is performed as seen in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
